name: Lingmala Waterfall
duration: 1.5 to 2 hours (including 1.5 km walk from gate to mini waterfall and 2.5 km to main waterfall viewpoint)
description: Lingmala Waterfall is a spectacular natural waterfall located between Mahabaleshwar and Panchgani on the Venna River. It features a main waterfall dropping nearly 500 feet and a smaller mini waterfall closer to the entry point which is safe for swimming and splashing. Surrounded by lush greenery and rocky mountains, it offers a tranquil atmosphere and scenic views, popular especially during monsoon and post-monsoon seasons.

startingPoint.name: Lingmala Waterfall Gate
startingPoint.description: The entry gate is accessible by road from Mahabaleshwar town (6 km away). Visitors park here and trek down stairs to reach the waterfalls. The path includes steps and two main trails branching to mini waterfall and main waterfall viewpoints.

networkAvailability.emergencyContact: Dial 108 or 112 if network is available

restaurants: Local tea stalls and snack vendors near entry gate
shops: Small shops selling packaged water and snacks
waterSources: No potable water except shops; carry own water

foodOptions: No food stalls on trek; carry snacks if needed
waterSources: Natural water from waterfall pools (not for drinking)

camping.reason: No camping permitted at or near Lingmala Waterfall site

nearbyStays.name: Mahabaleshwar Hotels and Guesthouses

permits.fee: INR 20 per person; INR 10 for camera
permits.notes: Entry tickets collected at the gate; avoid littering and follow safety rules.

commonRisks: Slippery stairs and rocky areas especially during monsoon
Steep descent and ascent requiring caution
No swimming allowed at main waterfall; swimming only at mini waterfall

steps: Turn right at signboard for Lingmala Waterfall

Drive via NH48 to Pune, then NH48 to Wai and SH72 to Mahabaleshwar

bestTimeToVisit: July to October (monsoon and post-monsoon for best flow and greenery)
